dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 1304 IH: Delaware River Basin Restoration Program Reauthorization Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Fitzpatrick (for himself, Mr. Evans of Pennsylvania, Ms. Sherrill, Mr. Boyle of Pennsylvania, Ms. Dean of Pennsylvania, Mr. Gottheimer, Ms. Houlahan, Mr. Kean, Ms. McBride, Mr. Norcross, Mr. Riley of New York, Ms. Scanlon, Mr. Van Drew, Mrs. Watson Coleman, and Mr. Conaway) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources, and in addition to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Water Infrastructure Improvements for the Nation Act to reauthorize Delaware River Basin conservation programs, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Delaware River Basin Restoration Program Reauthorization Act of 2025.

subsection.text: Section 3501(2) of the Water Infrastructure Improvements for the Nation Act (Public Law 114–322; 130 Stat. 1771) is amended by inserting Maryland, after Delaware,.

subsection.header: Definitions of Basin and Basin state
subsection.text: Section 3502 of the Water Infrastructure Improvements for the Nation Act (Public Law 114–322; 130 Stat. 1773) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by inserting Maryland, after Delaware,; and

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2), by inserting Maryland, after Delaware,.

subsection.text: Section 3504 of the Water Infrastructure Improvements for the Nation Act (Public Law 114–322; 130 Stat. 1775) is amended by adding at the end the following—
In selecting a project to be funded under the grant program, the Secretary may give priority to a project that serves a small, rural, or disadvantaged community.
Section 3507 of the Water Infrastructure Improvements for the Nation Act (Public Law 114–322; 130 Stat. 1775) is amended by striking 2023 and inserting 2032.
